Welcome

Soprano Singer | Teacher | Music Practitioner

Verity-Belle Atkinson is a classically trained soprano, vocal coach, and music practitioner based in the Vale of Glamorgan, performing and teaching throughout South Wales. She graduated from the Royal Welsh College of Music and Drama with First-Class Honours in her BMus degree and went on to complete her MMus in Music Performance with Distinction, also from the Royal Welsh College of Music and Drama, in 2021.

Services

Singing Lessons

1-2-1 private singing lessons taught from dedicated teaching space in Ewenny. For students of all ages.

Enquire now
Workshops

Vocal workshops for groups of up to 30 people. Suitable for choirs or schools.

Enquire now
Performances

Experienced operatic and musical theatre performer. Available for weddings, corporate functions and private events.

About

Verity-Belle hails from the picturesque market town of Cowbridge in South Wales. With a profound love for music and its transformative power, she believes in creating human connections through shared musical experiences. Verity-Belle finds immense joy in inspiring the next generation of performers and enriching communities through her work. She considers each musical session a unique and rewarding journey, deeply cherishing the privilege of calling this her profession.

Verity-Belle received her formal training at the prestigious Royal Welsh College of Music and Drama, where she graduated with First Class Honours in BMus Music. She furthered her studies with an MMus in Music Performance, earning Distinction in 2021. Her academic achievements reflect her dedication to her craft and her commitment to excellence in music education and performance.

As a Soprano, Verity-Belle has performed in high-profile productions, including Heggie’s Dead Man Walking with the Welsh National Opera Chorus and Janáček’s The Diary of One Who Disappeared alongside Nicky Spence and Simon Lepper. She has sung at the BBC Proms with the BBC National Chorus of Wales and frequently performs as a soloist with choral societies and male voice choirs across the UK.

Her commitment to outreach and education is demonstrated through collaborations with the BBC, Welsh National Opera, British Arts Council, Oasis Cardiff, and UK-American conferences, where she has developed and recorded impactful educational projects.

Verity-Belle also fosters young talent through her work as Vocal Coach for Stagecoach Performing Arts in Bridgend, guiding students aged 4–18, many of whom go on to perform on West End stages and at prominent events. Additionally, she teaches private singing lessons, helping students build their vocal skills and guiding them to successfully pass ABRSM singing exams.

As a Music Leader with the Forget Me Not Chorus, she has brought music and connection to care homes and hospitals since 2020, currently directing weekly sessions for FMNC Newport. Through her extensive experience, Verity-Belle continues to make a meaningful impact in both the professional music world and local communities.
